translation.en: [interviewer] Why do you think it's important to tell your story?
translation.ko: 앤서니 이야기를 하는 게 왜 중요할까요?

translation.en: Well, it's important 'cause my life is on the line,
and I want people to know that I'm not… I'm not crazy,
translation.ko: 사람들에게 알리고 싶어요 제가 미치지 않았고

translation.en: and I'm not a murderer and I'm innocent.
-[Anthony] Hello? -[operator] Sheriff's office. Sheriff's office.
And, what is the emergency?
[Anthony] I killed my dad.
[woman 1] The scariest thing about Anthony is I don't know if he has empathy.
translation.ko: 앤서니의 가장 무서운 점은 공감 능력이 안 느껴진다는 거예요

translation.en: I look at him and I don't see any feelings.
translation.ko: 앤서니를 보면 아무 감정도 보이지 않아요

translation.en: He was definitely shooting to kill, there is no doubt about it.
translation.ko: 죽이려고 총을 쐈다는 데 의심의 여지가 없어요

translation.en: [man 1] I couldn't understand why Anthony would do that.
translation.ko: 앤서니가 왜 그런 짓을 했는지 이해가 안 됐습니다

translation.en: Such a quiet, well-behaved young man.
The kid got anything he asked for.
translation.ko: 그 애는 말만 하면 뭐든 가졌어요

translation.en: I think he took an opportunity, and he did something about it.
translation.ko: 기회를 이용해서 뭔가 한 것 같아요

translation.en: [woman 2] I don't feel like he's guilty.
I feel like he was pushed to that point, and he was young and he broke.
translation.ko: 어린애가 상황에 몰려 이성을 잃은 거죠

translation.en: His father pleaded with Anthony, "Don't shoot me anymore."
And Anthony shoots him two more times.
[woman 1] I don't know the truth.
Not absolutely every bit of it.
There is one person on this planet that knows what happened,
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있었는지는 오직 한 사람 외엔

translation.en: and nobody else does.
[operator] 911, where is your emergency?
I just uh… killed my dad.
What do I need to tell you?
So you said you just killed your dad?
[Anthony] Yeah.
[operator] Okay, and um… Is he… Is he still alive, or…?
[Anthony] He might be. I don't know. I shot him like three times, I think.
translation.ko: 그럴 수도 있고 모르겠어요 제가 세 발 쐈거든요

translation.en: -[operator] You shot him three times? -[Anthony] I'm not sure.
translation.ko: - 세 발 쐈다고요? - 몇 발을 맞았는지 모르겠어요

translation.en: There's blood on the floor, so I know he's been shot once.
translation.ko: 바닥에 피가 흘렀으니 한 발은 맞았겠죠

translation.en: -I shot three times at him. -[operator] Okay…
[Anthony] He's on the ground.
[operator] All right, and what's your name?
[Anthony] Anthony Joseph Templet.
[woman] I'm an assistant district attorney and I'm the chief of litigation here.
The first time that I heard about Anthony Templet,
translation.ko: 앤서니 템플릿 사건 소식은 제 핸드폰으로 처음 받았어요

translation.en: it came across my phone because we'd get emails all the time
translation.ko: 앤서니 템플릿 사건 소식은 제 핸드폰으로 처음 받았어요 살인 사건이 터지면 항상 이메일이 오거든요

translation.en: when there's… there's a homicide.
translation.ko: 살인 사건이 터지면 항상 이메일이 오거든요

translation.en: I just remember thinking "Oh, that's sad.
You know, it's just, any time, you know, a son kills a father
it's something very unusual and it's a sad thing.
And listening to the 911 call was disturbing.
translation.ko: 신고 전화 녹음 파일을 듣는데 이상했어요

translation.en: And I thought, "Hm…"
"Gosh. That-- His affect is so flat."
[Anthony] I hear sirens.
[operator] You hear the deputies coming?
[Anthony] Yeah.
[man 2] This was the first time I've come to this neighborhood for a major incident.
translation.ko: 큰 사건으로 이 동네에 온 건 그때가 처음이었어요

translation.en: There's some places that you don't expect to get phone calls
translation.ko: 그런 일로 신고가 들어오거나 출동할 일은

translation.en: or dispatches of that type.
And this was… is one of those neighborhoods.
[operator] He's waiting outside. What color are you waiting in?
translation.ko: 밖에서 기다리고 있어요 무슨 색 옷을 입고 있나요?

translation.en: [Anthony] I'm outside.
I'm in blue gym shorts and a gray shirt.
[William] Dispatch told us that the subject said that
translation.ko: 사건 접수 담당이 말하길 체포 대상이

translation.en: the firearm was inside the residence, but you don't take that for granted.
translation.ko: 화기는 집 안에 있다고 했다지만 방심하면 안 됩니다

translation.en: You're always going to get out with the precautions that that person is armed.
translation.ko: 항상 상대가 무장하고 있다고 생각하고 행동해야 하죠

translation.en: [operator] Where exactly are you waiting?
[Anthony] By the road, by the mailboxes.
[William] Hands in the air!
He was very compliant.
He did exactly what he was told to do.
He wasn't crying.
Almost no emotions.
For the type of dispatch, yeah, that is odd.
[Anthony] I didn't understand what was going on.
I thought they needed to cuff me for a second,
translation.ko: 경찰이 저한테 잠시 수갑을 채워 놓고

translation.en: so that they could figure out what was going on
and then they'd let me go, but it didn't go that way.
translation.ko: 절 풀어 줄 줄 알았는데 그게 아니었죠

translation.en: [William] We went down the driveway through the carport in the back door,
which led into the kitchen.
I saw one revolver laying on the kitchen island with the hammer cocked back,
translation.ko: 공이치기가 젖혀진 리볼버가 아일랜드 식탁 위에 있었는데

translation.en: and the barrel was facing the entryway into the kitchen.
We made it through the kitchen, making sure that nobody else was in the house.
translation.ko: 우리는 주방을 지나 집에 아무도 없는 것을 확인했어요

translation.en: When I get into the master bedroom…
…located another firearm,
laying on the bed with the hammer back on it.
translation.ko: 공이치기가 젖혀진 채 침대 위에 있었죠

translation.en: And it was laying next to a cell phone.
We saw the victim laying there in the hallway.
He was laying there in a puddle of blood, still breathing.
translation.ko: 피 웅덩이 위에 누워 있었는데 숨이 붙어 있었어요

translation.en: EMS paramedics arrived on the scene.
They immediately move the victim out of the bathroom area.
And they loaded him up and left to the hospital.
Have a seat right there for me, please.
[Anthony] I didn't know how the system worked.
So I figured, "Okay… I'm gonna have to spend a little bit--" "A couple days in jail."
translation.ko: 그래서 감옥에 한 이틀 있겠구나 생각했죠

translation.en: But they took me down to, like, a holding cell, and started interrogating me.
translation.ko: 하지만 유치장으로 데려가더니 절 취조하기 시작했어요

translation.en: When Anthony first arrived at the Violent Crime unit,
he was really calm, he was quiet.
And I informed him that I was the investigator, here to talk to him.
translation.ko: 전 형사라고 소개하고 이야기를 하러 왔다고 했죠

translation.en: Asked him would he feel like talking about what happened?
He said, "Yes."
Let's start off by um… talking about who live at your house.
translation.ko: 우선 집에 누가 사는지부터 얘기해 볼까?

translation.en: Okay, so there's just me and my dad that live there.
And explain y'all's relationship.
Well, it's very off and on. We've… We have trouble getting along. And um…
Yeah, I don't really like him.
-You don't? -No.
Could you tell me why?
Well, I don't know. He just holds things over your head.
[Greg] He said his father would insult him,
call him bad names like a dickhead, or an asshole.
But that was nothing
that would supersede the homicide of his father.
[Greg] Let's talk about yesterday.
It was pretty normal. Had dinner. It was all good.
translation.ko: 평범했어요 저녁 먹고 아무 일 없었어요

translation.en: And I went to sleep.
And he started looking through my phone in the middle of the night,
translation.ko: 그런데 아빠가 한밤중에 제 핸드폰을 보기 시작했고

translation.en: and I was like, you know, "Why are you looking through my phone?"
So, like, "What the heck?" And we got into a big argument.
He was accusing me of calling-- Having calls with uh… my stepmother.
[Greg] Well, why wouldn't he want you to even talk to your stepmom?
translation.ko: 아빠는 왜 네가 새어머니와 통화하는 게 싫었을까?

translation.en: Oh, he's in a… I guess they're in a fight or something.
And he doesn't like secrets.
[Anthony] Susan and Burt had separated for six months before.
I was left alone in the house with him.
He wanted to talk to her really bad,
and I guess he just didn't want to feel left out, I guess.
He couldn't find nothing on my phone.
translation.ko: 아빠는 제 휴대폰에서 아무것도 못 찾자

translation.en: And then he started just yelling and going off about random stuff.
translation.ko: 고함을 치면서 잡히는 대로 던지기 시작했어요

translation.en: Things went from verbal to physical.
Anthony said that Burt was trying to punch him and grab him.
translation.ko: 앤서니는 버트가 자신을 때리고 붙잡으려 했다더군요

translation.en: But Anthony pushed him to the side,
and managed to run out of his room into Burt's room.
translation.ko: 가까스로 자기 방에서 버트 방으로 도망쳤어요

translation.en: [Anthony] I locked the door on him. And he started banging down the door.
translation.ko: 저는 문을 잠갔고 아빠는 문을 두드리기 시작했어요

translation.en: I was scared.
I was just scared I was going to get hurt.
I didn't really know what to think.
I'd figured I'd just get some guns to defend myself.
translation.ko: 총을 챙겨서 내 몸을 지켜야겠다고 생각했죠

translation.en: [Greg] You say, "guns" or "a gun"?
Oh, I grabbed two.
One-- I grabbed two in case one didn't work,
translation.ko: 안 쏴질 때를 대비해 두 자루를 챙겼죠

translation.en: because I'd never shot these guns in so long.
translation.ko: 그 총들을 쏘지 않은 지 오래됐거든요

translation.en: When somebody tell you they have a backup firearms,
they basically at the point that they intend to kill you.
He had told me about past experiences with him using the firearm,
translation.ko: 예전에 아버지와 화기를 다뤄 본 경험이 있다면서

translation.en: how it was easy to pull the trigger with the hammer pulled back.
translation.ko: 공이치기를 젖혀 놓으면 방아쇠를 당기기 쉽다더군요

translation.en: Did you warn him? Did you say anything?
"Hey." Did you tell him to stop?
No.
Did you say, "Hey, Dad, I got a gun"?
No-- Oh, he did accuse me.
He was like, "You going to shoot me, motherfucker?"
or something, through the door, and I was like…
And what did you say?
Nothing.
I just kept going-- I just kept getting the guns.
I felt like this was the worst I've ever seen him,
translation.ko: 아빠가 그 정도로 무섭게 군 건 처음이었고

translation.en: and I didn't see any other way that this was going to get resolved.
And I felt like my life was really in danger.
[Greg] Burt apparently was trying to force his way in the room.
There was evidence of that from the crack on the door.
He ended up stunning himself,
and I guess he, like, hit it wrong or something.
translation.ko: 아빠는 결국에 기절했어요 문에 잘못 부딪친 것 같았죠

translation.en: Heard a big grunt, or something like that.
He stopped banging on the door, and…
I opened the door…
I ended up shooting him.
In your dad's room, is there another door
to get to another part of the house?
Or is there a window, which you could climb out of?
There's a couple of windows, probably locked.
translation.ko: 창문이 두어 개 있는데 잠겨 있었을 거예요

translation.en: But I guess I could've opened them and got out.
translation.ko: 하지만 창문을 열고 나갈 수도 있었겠죠

translation.en: -[Greg] Is there a phone in there? -Yeah, there is.
-[Greg] In the room? -There is.
[Greg] Anthony had other avenues he could have taken,
but Anthony clearly stated he wanted to end everything.
translation.ko: 전부 끝내고 싶었다고 본인 입으로 분명히 말했어요

translation.en: [interviewer] Was there a choice when you opened that door?
translation.ko: 방문을 열었을 때 다른 선택은 없었나요?

translation.en: I felt like I didn't.
[interviewer] How did you feel after it happened?
translation.ko: 그 일이 벌어진 뒤 기분이 어땠나요?

translation.en: I mean, I felt terrible, but, you know, I didn't see any other way.
[Greg] I don't believe that Anthony was is any danger.
Anthony stated that Burt tried to physically attack him.
I did not see any bruising or injuries to Anthony
indicative of being involved in a fistic altercation.
Your scene'll tell you a lot of things about an incident.
translation.ko: "사건 현장 영상" 현장은 사건에 관해 많은 것을 알려 줍니다

translation.en: You talk about a fight or anything like that,
you could see overturned furniture, items that have fell to the floor.
translation.ko: 가구가 넘어져 있거나 물건이 바닥에 떨어져 있는데

translation.en: The home was very, very clean.
Nothing was out of order.
There wasn't even a dish in the sink.
Based on information learned, Anthony's statements,
and evidence at the scene,
there was probable cause to arrest Anthony.
He was booked for attempted manslaughter.
I woke up to a homicide call on June third
that my husband was in trauma neurocritical care at Our Lady of the Lake.
I went up to the hospital.
He's on a ventilator.
Machines out of every hole.
I held his lifeless hand,
and I told him I was so sorry, that I loved him.
No matter what, I loved him.
He was four days in the hospital.
And I turned the ventilator off on June 6th,
translation.ko: 6월 6일에 인공호흡기를 껐고 "아워 레이디 오브 더 레이크 병원"

translation.en: and he died.
[emotionally] At the hands of his own son.
[Greg] On June 6, 2019,
the East Baton Rouge parish coroner's office contacted me,
informed me that Burt Templet succumbed to his injuries.
The fatal wound was the gunshot wound to his head.
They removed fragments from his head,
and a projectile from his chest.
The pathologist ruled that Burt's death was a homicide.
Therefore, I upgraded the charges to manslaughter.
[reporter] Investigators upgraded the charges against this Baton Rouge teen.
He is accused of shooting his father, Burt Templet.
translation.ko: 소년은 아버지 버트 템플릿을 쏜 혐의를 받고 있습니다

translation.en: Now, we're told that the father has died from his injuries.
That means 17-year-old Anthony Templet will now face manslaughter charges.
translation.ko: 17세 소년 앤서니 템플릿은 우발 살인 혐의를 받을 것입니다

translation.en: Neighbors we spoke with today say that teen's father, Burt Templet,
translation.ko: 오늘 만나 본 이웃들이 말하길 소년의 아버지 버트 템플릿은

translation.en: was not well known in the neighborhood.
None of the neighbors wanted to go on camera,
but those that we spoke with said hardly anyone actually spent time
or regularly talked with Templet.
When this story fell into my lap, we had the basic information on it,
translation.ko: 제가 사건 취재를 맡았을 때 기본적인 정보는 있었지만

translation.en: but we of course wanted to know why.
And that was kind of my task at hand,
to try and figure out, to put on the news that night, was what happened.
translation.ko: 어떻게 된 건지 알아내서 보도하는 것이었죠

translation.en: My first involvement in this story was knocking on doors in the neighborhood,
trying to just get the most basic information
of who these people were.
It's not a large neighborhood. People know each other.
translation.ko: 크지 않은 동네라 주민끼리 다 알아요

translation.en: Neighbors talk to each other.
It's people that you'd have over to watch the game,
or have over for dinner or…
It's just your good Southern American families.
They were shaken a bit that this crime had happened right next door to them,
translation.ko: 옆집에서 이런 사건이 일어나서 주민들은 충격을 받았어요

translation.en: in a neighborhood that never had anything go on in it,
besides maybe a cookout, right?
They said that Burt was kind of that strange figure,
if they saw him, would appear drunk.
[neighbor 1] The thing that bothered me about Burt is he would really boast about
translation.ko: 버트가 좀 그런 게 자랑이라고 내세우는 게 "검찰 수사 인터뷰"

translation.en: getting drunk and partying.
[neighbor 2] He was definitely odd. He was definitely off.
I got a phone call from somebody on Gray Moss.
And they said that Burt had come over there and knocked on the door,
and was threatening with his wife.
And the husband said, "He was drunk, he'd been drinking,
and we told him to stay away from our house and from our property."
translation.ko: 본인들 집 마당에서 나가라고 했다고 했어요

translation.en: [Austin] No one knew too much about him. No one knew anything about Anthony.
translation.ko: 버트를 잘 아는 사람은 없었어요 사람들은 앤서니도 잘 몰랐죠

translation.en: They couldn't even probably tell you his age.
[neighbor 1] I ran into him when I was at Costco.
And this was the first time I'd ever met Anthony.
Anthony was just very withdrawn, you know.
[neighbor 2] When I was at their house, I didn't see him.
translation.ko: 버트의 집에 갔을 때 앤서니가 안 보였어요

translation.en: Anytime I drove by their house, I didn't see them.
translation.ko: 차를 타고 집을 지나쳐도 누굴 본 적이 없죠

translation.en: -[investigator] Visually, you never even… -[neighbor 2] No.
[investigator] …met or saw--?
-[neighbor 1] Never. -[neighbor 2] No.
[Anthony] I didn't talk to anybody for like maybe a week or two.
It was a scary time
because I didn't know where I was going, what I was going to do, or… anything.
translation.ko: 어디로 가고 뭘 하게 될지 몰랐으니까요

translation.en: [operator] This is a collect call from…
[Anthony] …Anthony Templet.
[man] Hey, are you there?
-[Anthony] Yeah. -[man] Hear me?
[Anthony] Calls are recorded, Got to watch what I say.
translation.ko: 통화가 녹음되고 있어서 말을 조심해야 해요

translation.en: [man] I know how this works.
[Anthony] My bond has been set to 100,000 now, from 50,000.
[man] Well, I knew it was gonna go up.
[Anthony] Yeah.
He called me. And I had a lot of questions about how the hell it happened.
translation.ko: 앤서니에게 전화가 왔는데 물어볼 게 너무 많았어요 "마이클 윌슨 시니어 수전의 오빠"

translation.en: Nobody indicated to me that there was ever any problems between Burt and Anthony.
translation.ko: 버트와 앤서니에게 문제가 있는 줄은 전혀 몰랐어요

translation.en: He paid for everything for Anthony.
In my eyes, he treated him like a king.
[Susan] When I first met Burt,
I was at a little sports bar watching the LSU game on my birthday.
translation.ko: 제 생일에 술집에서 풋볼 경기를 볼 때였어요

translation.en: Me and my first husband had fallen out,
and a friend introduced us.
We both loved to drink some beer, spend the day in the pool, barbecue.
translation.ko: 둘 다 맥주를 좋아하고 수영장, 바비큐를 좋아했어요

translation.en: Eventually, I was living with Burt and Anthony, and my son Peyton.
translation.ko: 결국 저, 버트, 앤서니 제 아들 페이턴이 같이 살게 됐죠

translation.en: Anthony was seven.
He had a funny personality.
He was laugh-y,
not a care in the world,
making funny faces, somewhat sarcastic,
non-caring, nonchalant.
We would do things in the kitchen together,
and it was like you gave him a million dollars.
'Cause somebody was doing something with him,
and not critiquing how he did everything.
Whenever Burt came into our lives,
our relationship was more conservative.
For an example, we didn't joke as openly.
translation.ko: 예를 들면 우린 터놓고 농담을 하지 않았죠

translation.en: And that is why
AJ did not like to come out of his room,
because then he had to deal with his father.
When he was around his dad, he couldn't be himself.
translation.ko: 아빠가 옆에 있으면 형은 편히 있지 못했어요

translation.en: He wasn't comfortable enough, he was too scared.
He always kinda found a way to make me feel like I was doing something wrong.
translation.ko: 아빠는 항상 내가 잘못한 것처럼 행동했어요

translation.en: It made me real-- feel really sad, and I didn't…
I felt really bad and guilty.
[Peyton] Burt, in his own strange way, loved his son.
However, AJ despised Burt.
[Susan] As he evolved, he became really quiet.
He was mostly to himself.
[Michael] Susan'd tell me that she was scared of Anthony.
She didn't know if he would shoot her,
if he'd kill her, if he'd hurt her.
She was afraid of him.
Anthony has no emotion.
And you can never tell whether he's angry or happy.
translation.ko: 화났는지 행복한지 절대 구분할 수 없죠

translation.en: You can never tell anything. It's just a flatline.
translation.ko: 감정이 전혀 안 보여요 로봇 같아요

translation.en: I don't know if he has empathy.
translation.ko: 앤서니에겐 공감 능력이 없는 것 같아요

translation.en: When I watched the interview the first time, I was like,
translation.ko: 인터뷰 영상을 처음 봤을 때 생각했어요

translation.en: "Oh, my gosh,
there's not a tear shed for his father."
translation.ko: '아버지를 위해 눈물 한 방울도 안 흘리네'

translation.en: I shot him once or twice-- It was two times more.
translation.ko: 아빠를 한 발인가 두 발 쏘고… 두 발 더 쐈어요

translation.en: At least I shot the gun three times, but I don't know how many times I hit him. [Greg] Mm-hmm.
translation.ko: 최소 세 발은 쐈는데 맞은 게 몇 발인지는 몰라요

translation.en: I was just kind of like… you know?
Having been in this system for 44 years,
you normally see folks that are crying.
You're upset, you're angry.
"Why did he make me do it? This was going on. This is why I did what I did."
translation.ko: '상대가 왜 그랬을까? 이렇게 됐다, 그래서 내가 그랬다'

translation.en: Just wasn't there, it was flat.
My dad just made me, you know, kind of stop caring about…
about my feelings, and just started to kinda,
I guess, let go of them, I guess.
I probably felt love for my dad in my younger years, but as I got older,
translation.ko: 어릴 때는 아빠를 사랑했겠지만 나이를 먹으면서

translation.en: it started to go away.
I just try to have no feelings.
I just try not-- I just try to pretend it never even happened,
translation.ko: 그냥 아무 일 없었던 것처럼 생각하려고 하죠

translation.en: and that helps me move on, so…
translation.ko: 그 편이 극복하는 데 도움이 돼요

translation.en: [interviewer] Do you want to live having no feelings? Do you want to have feelings?
translation.ko: 감정 없이 살고 싶어요? 다시 감정을 느끼고 싶어요?

translation.en: I can have feelings for people. I just choose not to for him.
translation.ko: 저도 감정이 있는데 아빠에게만 무덤덤한 거예요

translation.en: There was one thing, kind of struck me as, "Wow, that's very weird."
-[Greg] Anthony, how old are you? -Seventeen.
-[Greg] You're 17? -Yeah.
[Greg] And your date of birth is what?
It's either September 13th, 2001, or two. I can't remember which one.
[Greg coughs] And what's your current address?
-My home address? -[Greg] Yes, sir.
One-seven… 652 Gray Moss Avenue, I think.
Again, can't really remember.
[Dana] He doesn't know his own birth date. He doesn't know his address.
translation.ko: 자기가 태어난 해도 모르고 집 주소도 몰라요

translation.en: Who doesn't know their address?
I had more questions after the interview than I had answers.
translation.ko: 인터뷰를 보고 나니 궁금한 게 더 많아졌어요

translation.en: [man] When people find out that I'm in Louisiana,
that I'm an attorney here, a criminal defense attorney… [laughs]
…I get, "Man, you're always gonna be in business." [chuckles]
translation.ko: 밥줄 끊길 일은 없겠다는 말을 많이 들어요

translation.en: I mean, there are shootings and murders every week in Baton Rouge.
translation.ko: 배턴루지에서는 매주 총격 사건과 살인 사건이 벌어지죠

translation.en: Like clockwork.
We have the highest incarceration rate in the country.
translation.ko: 우리 주가 국내에서 교도소 수감률이 가장 높아요

translation.en: Is that a product of the criminal justice system?
Or is that a product of the fact that the people of Louisiana are a little crazy?
translation.ko: 아니면 루이지애나 사람들이 조금은 미쳤다는 의미일까요?

translation.en: Frankly, I have a history of drinking like a crazy person,
translation.ko: 사실 전 예전에 미친 듯이 술을 마셨고

translation.en: and I have been in a hundred bar fights.
Louisianians are survivors.
And I think that that's part my personality,
translation.ko: 그게 제 성격의 한 부분을 차지하고 있고

translation.en: but it's also part of what's ingrained in me about being a Louisiana boy.
translation.ko: 루이지애나 토박이로서 제 몸에 깊이 배어 있죠

translation.en: I know how to survive.
I embrace that part of me that is kind of crazy,
translation.ko: 조금은 미쳤고 정상에서 약간 벗어난 면도

translation.en: that is a little out of the box.
And I can see in my clients that there are good people who made serious mistakes.
translation.ko: 의뢰인들을 보면 큰 실수를 저질렀지만 좋은 사람들이에요

translation.en: I heard the public story about Anthony's case,
what's in the newspaper.
But that's it. That's all I've got.
And someone else hooked me up with Susan,
Anthony's stepmom.
And I spoke to her and I said, "Look, this is who I am,
I'm exceedingly good at this."
And I wanted to talk to Anthony. You know, "Is this true?"
"Was this really self-defense?"
Is this what really happened, or is this some made-up story,
and he killed his dad in cold blood one night?
I really don't know what's happening, right?
So I went to the jail to talk to Anthony.
-[Jarrett] How you doing? -[Anthony] I'm doing pretty good.
[Jarrett] You okay? Okay.
So essentially, AJ-- Can I call you AJ?
[Anthony] AJ or Anthony, whichever you prefer.
translation.ko: 네, AJ든 앤서니든 좋을 대로 부르세요

translation.en: -[Jarrett] What do you prefer? -[Anthony] Anthony.
translation.ko: 그래, 넌 뭐가 더 좋니? - 앤서니요 - 알겠다

translation.en: [Jarrett] Okay.
It was unbelievably difficult.
It was hard to get him to share anything or talk at all.
translation.ko: 앤서니에게 상황이나 이야기를 듣는 게 쉽지 않았죠

translation.en: At that time, he was really, really bad at communicating his own life,
translation.ko: 당시에 앤서니는 자기 삶이나 소송에 관해

translation.en: or the instance, or whatever.
It was important to us to know what actually was going on in the house.
translation.ko: 그 집에서 실제로 어떤 일이 있었는지 아는 게 중요했기에

translation.en: So we sent our investigators out
to talk to people that were close or related to Burt Templet.
translation.ko: 버트 템플릿과 친하거나 관계된 사람들을 만났죠

translation.en: I wanted to talk to his best friend.
A best friend, usually you can get kind of like a little bit more information.
translation.ko: 대개 절친한 친구에게서 정보를 더 얻을 수 있으니까요

translation.en: [friend] I was probably about 15 or 16 when I first met Burt.
He was a good friend.
He knew everything.
And he always, of course, tried to be the man of the crowd.
He told me he worked in plants at times.
Uh… I really wasn't very clear about what exactly he did.
translation.ko: 정확히 무슨 일을 하는지는 잘 몰랐어요

translation.en: He said he made a lot of money, supposedly.
He had a lot of nice things, a nice house.
translation.ko: 좋은 것들이 많고 좋은 집도 있었어요

translation.en: [Susan] He was a project controls engineer that made $100 an hour.
translation.ko: 버트는 프로젝트 관리 기술자로 시간당 100달러를 벌었어요

translation.en: [quavers] He was an excellent provider.
We had new cars. We had…
…a beautiful home.
We bought a swimming pool. We put it up together. [sniffles]
We would go on trips out the wazoo.
[James] On the weekends, we'd hang out, and swim and barbecue,
translation.ko: 주말이면 놀러 가서 수영하고 바비큐 파티도 하고

translation.en: and high-fiving, hugging, telling each other,
translation.ko: 하이파이브하고 껴안고 서로 사랑한다고 말하곤 했어요

translation.en: "I love you, my brother." [quavers] You know?
AJ was pretty much to himself.
We hung out in the pool a few times, not much at all.
translation.ko: 수영장에서 같이 논 적이 거의 없을 정도죠

translation.en: Anthony was real quiet.
Every time I'd go in the house, he'd be on his laptop, on the computer,
translation.ko: 집에 들어가 보면 항상 노트북이나 컴퓨터로

translation.en: he would be in there playing his video games.
I couldn't understand why Anthony would do that.
translation.ko: 앤서니가 왜 그런 짓을 했는지 이해가 안 됐습니다

translation.en: Such a quiet
and well-behaved young man.
How could he shoot your own father?
translation.ko: 어떻게 자기 아버지를 쏠 수 있었는지

translation.en: Now, they say that you never know what goes behind closed doors.
translation.ko: 남의 집 사정은 절대 모르는 법이라고 하잖아요

translation.en: Burt ended up putting cameras up on the house.
Like all the entrances, driveways…
The entire house is on surveillance cameras,
except for the master bedroom.
[Michael] There's eight cameras outside.
Most people put them up to secure their home.
[Susan] He wanted to protect us.
Keep the family safe.
I love you so much.
Do I think it's unusual for him to have cameras? No.
translation.ko: 버트가 카메라를 설치한 게 이상하진 않아요

translation.en: Did he have underlying intent?
Maybe.
Anything and everything immediately outside of the house, he saw.
translation.ko: 집 밖에 뭔가 있으면 바로 아빠가 봤어요

translation.en: I didn't like it, but I chose to look past it at the time.
translation.ko: 전 그게 싫었지만 그땐 무시하기로 했죠

translation.en: [woman] Creepy.
That made me think-- That was very creepy to be checking on your child like that.
translation.ko: 자식을 그렇게 확인하다니 생각만 해도 소름 돋죠

translation.en: When I met Anthony, I think he was 16.
Anthony and I worked shoulder to shoulder, most days.
translation.ko: 앤서니와 저는 매일같이 어깨를 맞대고 일했죠

translation.en: I felt a little bit like a mom for him,
only because, you know, he didn't seem to have a mother figure there.
My boss, Scott, lived in the same subdivision as Burt Templet.
translation.ko: 제 상사인 스콧은 버트 템플릿과 한동네에 살았어요

translation.en: On June 3rd, Scott called me before work started
and said, "Hey, I just got a phone call from some of the neighbors."
"There was a shooting at Anthony's house."
It seemed like, in the news media, it was just a random shooting,
translation.ko: 기사만 보면 무차별 총격 사건 같았어요

translation.en: this privileged white boy just shooting his dad.
translation.ko: 잘 사는 백인 소년이 그냥 아빠를 쏜 거죠

translation.en: But I knew there was more with this story.
translation.ko: 하지만 저는 사연이 있다는 걸 알고 있었어요

translation.en: I just wanted his story to be heard.
Burt knew Scott, and so that's how Anthony had gotten a job at the greenhouse.
translation.ko: "2018년 2월" 버트와 스콧이 아는 사이라 앤서니가 온실에서 일하게 됐어요

translation.en: [Scott] It started off with his dad
repeatedly asking me whether I could give his son a job.
translation.ko: 아들에게 일을 시켜 달라고 계속 부탁했어요

translation.en: I told Burt, "But I don't know your son."
translation.ko: 전 버트에게 말했죠 '난 자네 아들을 몰라'

translation.en: "Maybe if we get a chance to meet each other, I can give you an answer."
[Elena] They went out to eat,
you know, just to meet Anthony beforehand, to get an idea.
translation.ko: 먼저 앤서니를 만나서 어떤 아이인지 보려고요

translation.en: [Scott] And I was trying to get to know Anthony.
I couldn't ask him a question without Burt being the one to answer everything.
translation.ko: 앤서니에게 뭘 물어봐도 버트가 전부 대답했어요

translation.en: Burt had-- He wanted to be in control the whole time.
translation.ko: 버트는 내내 주도권을 잡고 싶어 했죠

translation.en: So we put him to work.
My first impressions of Anthony… Uh… [sighs]
He just seemed--
It was like he had never been outside of his house,
translation.ko: 한 번도 집 밖에 나온 적 없는 아이 같았어요

translation.en: honestly, is what it seemed like.
He had never heard of, you know, Tom Hanks or Tom Cruise.
He did something right, I said, "Hey, up top, Anthony! Up top!"
translation.ko: 앤서니가 뭘 잘했을 때 '앤서니, 한 번 치자'라고 하면

translation.en: He looked at me like, "What does that mean?"
translation.ko: 무슨 뜻인지 모른다는 듯 절 빤히 봤어요

translation.en: And I was like, "You know, give me a high five!"
"You know what that is, right?" "No, I don't know what that is."
I just thought Anthony had been seriously neglected.
He didn't ever meet any of his relatives for the holidays.
He didn't know if he had any grandparents.
He didn't know his mom.
I had asked him, "What is her name?" He didn't know her name.
[Scott] I knew he was homeschooled.
I have employed many homeschooled kids
translation.ko: 홈스쿨링을 한 아이들을 많이 고용해 봤는데

translation.en: and often their social abilities are lacking to some degree.
So I thought maybe that was the biggest part of it.
translation.ko: 앤서니도 그 이유가 큰가 보다 했는데

translation.en: But the boy just couldn't talk. [chuckles] You know?
translation.ko: 그 아이는 그냥 말을 못 했어요

translation.en: [Elena] I would try to engage him in conversation,
and ask him, you know, about where he was in school.
He never could quite tell me what classes he was in though.
translation.ko: 어떤 수업을 듣는다고 제대로 말한 적이 없어요

translation.en: I knew, you know, it wasn't right, but it wasn't enough for me to look into.
translation.ko: 이상하다는 건 알았지만 나서서 알아볼 정도까진 아니었죠

translation.en: His dad was keeping serious tabs on him with a GPS tracker on his phone.
translation.ko: 버트는 앤서니를 지독하게 감시했어요 애 핸드폰에 위치 추적 앱까지 깔아 뒀죠

translation.en: There was a couple of times when Burt called my boss and said,
translation.ko: 버트가 제 상사에게 두어 번 전화한 적도 있어요

translation.en: "Hey, I noticed on Anthony's GPS tracker he hasn't moved in the last 30 minutes."
"What's he doing? What's going on?"
It would be because he was standing there fertilizing like a set group of pots.
translation.ko: 그도 그럴 것이 앤서니가 화분에 비료를 주고 있었거든요

translation.en: It was in one location.
That was weird.
After June 3rd, I went back
and I looked at Anthony's application a little more closely
translation.ko: 앤서니의 지원서를 좀 더 자세히 살펴보니까

translation.en: and realized that Burt had typed up the application for Anthony.
translation.ko: 앤서니의 지원서를 좀 더 자세히 살펴보니까 버트가 앤서니 대신 컴퓨터로 작성한 걸 깨달았어요

translation.en: I was looking on there to see what it said for education,
and it said "Kaplan Prep."
When I went back and researched Kaplan Prep School,
it was actually not a prep school.
It was a website to order standardized testing materials.
So he actually never went to-- Was never homeschooled.
translation.ko: 그러니까 앤서니는 홈스쿨링을 한 적 없었던 거죠

translation.en: That's when I kind of thought, "Okay, maybe something is going on."
translation.ko: 뭔가 심상치 않다는 생각이 그때 들었어요

translation.en: "This is not just a random shooting. You know, like maybe there's a reason."
translation.ko: 무차별 총격이 아니라 이유가 있을지 모른다고요

translation.en: The question then also was,
"Where is Anthony's mom?"
And that's when I called Shayna Landry.
Anthony came into my life
by sheer accident.
My husband called me one day and he said,
"Hey, have you heard anything about this kid in the news
that shot his father?"
And I said, "Well, it seems pretty cut and dry to me."
"I read the story and it sounds like snobby, rich kid
translation.ko: '기사 봤는데 잘 사는 집 건방진 꼬마가'

translation.en: that got mad at his dad and shot him."
He told me that his coworker knew Anthony's manager,
translation.ko: 남편 동료가 앤서니의 매니저와 아는 사이인데

translation.en: and there was a lot more to the story.
He suggested that Elena call me
translation.ko: 남편은 엘리나에게서 연락이 올 거라고 했어요

translation.en: because of my background in solving DNA puzzles.
translation.ko: 제가 DNA 퍼즐을 푸는 데 전문가거든요

translation.en: I had a little shock a couple of years ago
and found out that the man that I originally thought was my father wasn't.
translation.ko: 우리 아버지인 줄 알았던 사람이 실은 아니란 걸 알았거든요

translation.en: And I did a DNA test
and found out that my father
was someone totally different and he had no idea that I existed.
translation.ko: 완전히 다른 사람이었고 저의 존재 자체를 모르더라고요

translation.en: So I continued to help other families find their DNA matches
translation.ko: 그래서 저는 다른 가족들을 도와 DNA를 확인하거나

translation.en: or solve their mysteries.
I've located,
I guess almost 40 fathers
or other family members that show up in people's DNA.
I called Shayna… [inhales]
…and I said, "Okay,
someone needs to find his mom."
I was like, "Let me give it a shot."
I wanted to do a DNA test.
The initial jail he was in, though,
was very rough,
and they did not allow outside visitors at all.
But I couldn't let it go.
I was blasting social media,
trying to find out if anyone knows something about Anthony,
but I couldn't find anything.
Due to Anthony being a minor,
I knew that none of his information would show up online.
So I started looking at Burt pretty hard.
I found some criminal records.
There were some felonies, some misdemeanors,
but they were all assault charges.
And one of them specifically jumped out to me
because it said "assault with bodily injury of a family member."
translation.ko: 폭행으로 가족에게 부상을 입혔다고 돼 있었어요

translation.en: And that one was done the same year that Anthony was born.
I knew that he was born in Texas.
translation.ko: 앤서니의 출생지가 텍사스인 걸 알고 있었어요

translation.en: I have a private investigator friend who drove to Houston
looking for more details.
He was trying to find out if we could figure out who the victim was in the domestic violence cases.
translation.ko: 가정 폭행 건의 피해자가 누구인지 조사했죠

translation.en: [Elena] Shayna starts looking, and I thought, "How long is this gonna take her?"
translation.ko: 셰이너가 조사를 시작했고 전 얼마나 걸릴지 궁금했어요

translation.en: "Because Anthony is locked up in jail
and I don't want him to just kind of get lost in the system."
"So I don't want to tell her to hurry up,
but I need her to hurry up," and so… [laughs]
[Shayna] I started using this website that I use to find family members.
translation.ko: 평소에 가족을 찾을 때 쓰는 웹사이트에 들어갔어요

translation.en: It's like a paid version of WhitePages,
translation.ko: 옛날 전화번호부의 유료 버전 같은 건데

translation.en: but it gives anyone who maybe got mail
at the same home as them
at any given time, as an "associate."
I wanted to see if I could find any associates from Texas
since I knew Anthony was born there.
And I found this girl
associated with Burt.
And the way she spells her name, "Netasha," is very unique.
She has an "e" in the beginning of it instead of an "a."
So it's "N-E-T-A-S-H-A."
So it wasn't hard to just find her on Facebook.
[Elena] She sent me a picture and said, "Do you think this could be his sister?"
translation.ko: 셰이너가 사진을 보내면서 앤서니의 누나인지 물었고

translation.en: And I was like,
"Oh, my gosh, that's absolutely his sister."
[Shayna] I sent her a Facebook message that day.
But the way Facebook works,
is because we weren't friends, it went into the secret mailbox
translation.ko: 우린 친구가 아니어서 메시지가 숨겨진 수신함으로 갔고

translation.en: that she didn't see for a few days.
After reading my message,
Netasha immediately got with her mom and gave me a call.
translation.ko: 너타샤는 곧바로 어머니와 함께 제게 연락했어요

translation.en: And I happened to be on the phone with Elena,
so I actually conference-called them in.
We told them together that we were looking to help Anthony.
translation.ko: 우린 앤서니를 도울 방법을 찾고 있다고 말했어요

translation.en: They actually called him AJ at first.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 처음에 앤서니를 AJ라고 불렀는데

translation.en: Neither of us knew him by that nickname,
so we were a little confused at first.
I started digging for the story,
and immediately they sent me the missing poster.
translation.ko: 두 사람은 곧바로 실종 아동 포스터를 보내 줬어요

translation.en: He was legitimately a missing child, with the poster and everything.
translation.ko: 앤서니는 정말 실종 아동이었어요 포스터와 모든 게 다 있었죠

translation.en: That shocked me.
As soon as I heard that,
chills go up my spine.
We start with a major development in the case.
Just weeks after Anthony Templet
is accused of shooting and killing his father,
translation.ko: 사망에 이르게 한 지 몇 주가 지난 지금

translation.en: we learned he may have been snatched from his home more than a decade ago.
translation.ko: 앤서니가 10여 년 전에 납치됐을 가능성이 제기됐죠

translation.en: Part of the puzzle is this flier that actually surfaced from over a decade ago,
translation.ko: 10여 년 전의 이 전단이 바로 그 퍼즐 조각인데요

translation.en: claiming Templet was taken from his own home by his own father.
translation.ko: 친부가 집에서 템플릿을 납치했다고 돼 있습니다

translation.en: [Jarrett] There was all these questions in my head about what could have happened.
translation.ko: 대체 어떻게 된 것인지 온갖 물음이 떠올랐어요

translation.en: Had the kid been caged in his home?
Now, I've since learned
just how bad it was.
